page.title: 20FARM LABOURERS REVOLT
page.content: The inn has always been a meeting place of the villagers.In 1830 farm labourers gathered outside the'Red lion 'to protest against their low wages.They were spurred into action by hearing that King Charles X had fled from France in the face of angry farm labourers there.He had taken refuge with the Weld Family at Lulworth Castle.The local magistate,James Frampton,read the Ript Act and three people were arrested.Four years later James Frampton was to play a key role in the imprisonment of six farm workers at Tolpuddle. During recent years this area has atrracted the interest of the media. Some of the B.B.C.'s Hardy's 'Wessex Tales'were filmed here,as was part of the major film'far from the Madding Crowd'.
